refnamediv.refpurpose: Sums the magnitudes across all channels of the spectrum.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Sums the magnitudes across all channels of the spectrum.

refsect1.title: Initialization
refsect1.para: interp (optional, default-0) -- if non-zero, interpolate the output signal (koct or ksum). The default value is 0 (repeat the signal value between changes).

refsect1.title: Performance
refsect1.para: Sums the magnitudes across all channels of the spectrum. At each new frame of wsig, the magnitudes are summed and released as a scalar ksum signal. Between frames, the output is either repeated or interpolated at the k-rate. This unit produces a k-signal summation of the magnitudes present in the spectral data, and is thereby a running measure of its moment-to-moment overall strength.

informalexample.programlisting: ksum specsum wsig, 1 ; sum the spec bins, and ksmooth if ksum < 2000 kgoto zero ; if sufficient amplitude koct specptrk wsig ; pitch-track the signal kgoto contin zero: koct = 0 ; else output zero contin:
